results.title: Hokusai: 'Thirty-six views of Mount Fuji'
results.brief_description: The narration in the film gives detailed information on the life and work of Hokusai. The film explores his “Thirty-six Views of Mt Fuji” and his art showing the life of the common man. Also outlines the history of modern Japanese art. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hog family 'supreme'
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, Lawrence Cherry, Evelyn Cherry and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: More than fifty percent of Prince Edward Island’s hog production is classified Grade A. From a plan for live-hog grading we see how further standards were devised, culminating in the superior quality that makes Island breeding stock popular around the world.

results.title: Hoddle Street
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, Jonathan Holmes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: On Sunday 9th August, 1987 at approximately 9.30pm a mass killing took place in Hoddle Street, Clifton Hill, a suburb of Melbourne. Julian Knight killed seven people and injured nineteen others in a shooting spree that was to leave a devastating and lasting effect on, not only the local residents of Clifton Hill, but on all Victorians. Melbourne lost its innocence that night. This film is told in three parts. Part one: the build-up - covers Julian Knight’s background and his obsessions and fantasies of being a soldier in combat. Part two: the night - retraces Julian’s route on the night of the shootings, and the events that took place according to the survivors, the police and witnesses. Part three: the aftermath - relates the disbelief, anger and distress felt by all and the formation of support groups for the victims and their families. Deals with the rise of the Anti-Gun Lobby, and the cry for tougher gun laws. Television footage, police interviews, interviews with victims and their families and forensic psychologists have been compiled to produce this compelling documentary. Written and narrated by Jonathan Holmes.

results.title: Hockey-the Skills Revolution
results.brief_description: This program demonstrates the latest techniques and skills using the Australian National Team players and their coach, Richard Aggiss. Receiving skills, possession skills, elimination skills, passing skills, goal scoring, penalty strokes, tackles and goal keeping are all demonstrated by world champions Charlesworth, Walsh, Bell, Hazelhurst, Snowden and Berce. Endorsed by the Australian Hockey Association.

results.title: HMAS Stalwart
results.brief_description: The destroyer tender HMAS Stalwart is the largest naval vessel yet built in Australia. Designed to provide maintenance facilities, the ship has a well equipped workshop for repairs usually done ashore.

results.title: Hitler: the final chapter
results.creator_credit: Cyril Jones and Cyril Jones and Associates
results.brief_description: One of the most discussed questions in history, “what really happened to Hitler?” is the subject of this investigative documentary, written and produced by Cyril Jones. He uses footage obtained from the Russian Film Archives to support his case as well as the testimony of Elena Rjeveskaia, last surviving member of the SMERSH team. The documentary also covers the fate of Hitler’s chosen successor, Dr Joseph Goebbels, and his family.

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.
